text: Oukaïmeden Observatory (obs. code: J43) is an astronomical observatory located in the commune of Oukaïmden in the Atlas Mountains of Morocco, where the Morocco Oukaimeden Sky Survey is conducted to observe small Solar System bodies. == Telescope == Located in the Atlas Mountains, 2750 meters above sea level, the TRAPPIST-North telescope is a twin telescope of TRAPPIST-South located at the La Silla Observatory in Chile, both operated from Liège, Belgium, by the Space Center of the University of Liège. == Discovery == In May 2016, data from the telescopes helped identify TRAPPIST-1. == See also == * * Rabat Observatory == References == Category:Astronomical observatories in Morocco Category:Buildings and structures in Marrakesh-Safi Category:Minor- planet discovering observatories
title: Oukaïmeden Observatory
